page.title: 04THE CHINA CLAY INDUSTRY PT3
page.content: Firstly the soil and rock overburden is removed and a pit is dug.The deeper the pit, the wider the sides must become to ensure stability of the sides of the pit. Kaolin or China Clay is{extracted}from the granite rock by {washing}it out. Remote controlled and extremely powerful hoses with water pressure in the region of 250-300psi are directed at the rock. The{claystream,composed of water,sand, {china clay and mica residue}flows to the bottom of the pit, from where it is pumped to the{classifiers(sand {separation point).}Coarse sand is removed and taken away by conveyor belt to the tip.The clay, mica residue and water then passes into{cyclone {separators}where the fine mica sand is removed.The{slurry}then passes into settling tanks and is piped out of the area for further processing.
